Description: Parameter out of permissible value range
Cause: The value entered was outside of the permissible value range for this parameter.
Correctives: The entered value must be within the permissible value range.

Description: Parameter does not exist
Cause: Error detected by parameter management: Parameter (index) does not exist.
Correctives: Select a different parameter (index).

Description: Parameter does not exist
Cause: Error detected by parameter management: Parameter (subindex) does not exist.
Correctives: Select a different parameter (subindex).

Description: Parameter write not permissible (READ only)
Cause: Write access to read only parameter.
Correctives: Write only to parameters that are not read-only.

Description: Write access denied (no access authorization)
Cause: Parameter only accessible at expert level.
Correctives: The write access level expert is required.

Description: Block Upload/Download not initialized
Command not permissible while power stage is active
Cause: Command not permissible while the power stage is enabled (operating state Operation Enabled or Quick Stop Active).
Correctives: Disable the power stage and repeat the command.

Description: Access via other interface blocked
Cause: Access occupied by another channel (for example: Commissioning software is active and fieldbus access was tried at the same time).
Correctives: Verify the channel that blocks access.

Description: File cannot be uploaded: Incorrect file ID
Data stored after a power outage is invalid
System error detected: No bootloader available
Configuration error detected (additional info=Modbus register address)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 30
Cause: Error detected during parameter check (for example, reference velocity value for operating mode Profile Position is greater than maximum permissible velocity of drive).
Correctives: Value in additional error information shows the Modbus register address of the parameter where the initialization error was detected.

Description: Basic configuration of drive required after factory setting
Cause: The "First Setup" (FSU) was not run at all or not completed.
Correctives: Perform a First Setup.

Description: Parameter changed that requires a restart of the drive
Cause: Only displayed by the commissioning software.A parameter modification requires the drive to be powered off and on.
Correctives: Restart the drive to activate the parameter functionality.See the chapter Parameters for the parameter that requires a restart of the drive.

Description: Function not available in this type of device
Cause: The specific type of device does not support this function or this parameter value.
Correctives: Verify that you have the correct device type, in particular type of motor, type of encoder, holding brake.

Description: Incorrect file ID for upload or download
Cause: The specific type of device does not support this kind of file.
Correctives: Verify that you have the correct device type or the correct configuration file.

Description: File transfer not correctly initialized
Cause: A previous file transfer has been aborted.

Description: Locking of configuration denied
Cause: An external tool has tried to lock the configuration of the drive for upload or download. This may not work because another tool had already locked the configuration of the drive or the drive is in an operating state that does not allow locking.

Description: System not locked for configuration transfer
Cause: An external tool has tried to transfer the configuration without locking the drive.

Description: Configuration download abortedParameter_SigLatchedBit 5
Cause: During a configuration download, a communication error or an error in the external tool was detected. The configuration was only partially transferred to the drive and might be inconsistent now.
Correctives: Power the drive off/on and retry to download the configuration or restore the factory settings.

Description: Incorrect configuration file formatParameter_WarnLatchedBit 5
Cause: An external tool has downloaded a configuration which has an incorrect format.

Description: Request is processed asynchronously
Asynchronous request blocked
Cause: Request to a module is blocked because the module is currently processing another request.

Description: Configuration data incompatible with device
Cause: The configuration data contains data from a different device.
Correctives: Verify device type including type of power stage.

Description: Incorrect data length, too many bytes
Incorrect data length, insufficient number of bytes
Configuration download error detected (additional info=Modbus register address)
Cause: During a configuration download, one or more configuration values were not accepted by the drive.
Correctives: Verify that the configuration file is valid and matches the type and version of the drive. The value in the additional error info shows the Modbus register address of the parameter where the initialization error was detected.

Description: Not possible to initialize recalculation for scaling
Cause: A parameter could not be initialized.
Correctives: The address of the parameter that caused the detected error can be read via the parameter _PAR_ScalingError.

Description: Original state of a parameter cannot be restored after an error was detected during recalculation of parameters with user-defined units.
Cause: The drive contained an invalid configuration before the recalculation was started. An error was detected during the recalculation.
Correctives: Power the drive off and on again. This may help you to identify the affected parameter(s). Change the parameters as required. Verify that the parameter configuration is valid before starting the recalculation procedure.

Description: Not possible to recalculate data set
Cause: A data set of the operating mode Motion Sequence could not be recalculated.
Correctives: The address of the parameter and the number of the data set that caused this condition can be read via the parameter _PAR_ScalingError.

Description: Recalculation not possible.
Cause: Invalid scaling factor.
Correctives: Verify that you really want the selected scaling factor. Try a different scaling factor. Before triggering scaling, reset the parameters with user-defined units.

Description: Recalculation for scaling not possible
Cause: A parameter could not be recalculated.
Correctives: The address of the parameter that caused this condition can be read via the parameter _PAR_ScalingError.

Description: Incorrect sequence of steps for scaling (fieldbus)
Cause: The recalculation has been started prior to the initialization.
Correctives: The recalculation must be started after the initialization.

Description: Recalculation for scaling not possible
Cause: Recalculation for scaling is already running.
Correctives: Wait for the running recalculation for scaling to finish.

Description: Parameter cannot be changed
Cause: Recalculation for scaling is running.
Correctives: Wait for the running recalculation for scaling to finish.

Description: Timeout during recalculation for scaling
Cause: The time between the initialization of the recalculation and the start of the recalculation has been exceeded (30 seconds).
Correctives: Recalculation must be started within 30 seconds after initialization.

Description: Scaling not possible
Cause: The scaling factors for position, velocity or acceleration/deceleration are beyond internal calculation limits.
Correctives: Retry with different scaling factors.

Description: Configuration is blocked by another access channel
Correctives: Close other access channel (for example, other instance of commissioning software).

Description: Invalid key received
Special login is required for Manufacturing Test Firmware
Test step not yet started
Not possible to enable the capture input
Cause: Position capturing has not yet been activated
Correctives: Activate position capturing via procedure command "Probing cycle" (IDN170).

Description: Not possible to configure difference value capturing
Cause: Capture input 1 has not been set to both edges (IDN169).
Correctives: Set capture input 1 to both edges.

Description: Not possible to configure difference value capturing
Cause: Capture input 2 has not been set to both edges (IDN169).
Correctives: Set capture input 2 to both edges.

Description: Configuration of edges cannot be changed
Cause: The configuration of edges cannot be changed because difference value capture is active.
Correctives: Deactivate difference value capture.

Description: Incorrect parameter setting
Cause: The parameter ENC_ModeOfMaEnc is set to "Velocity And Position". The parameter ErrorResp_PDiffEncM is set to "Error Class 1" or "Error Class 2". The combination of these settings is invalid.
Correctives: Set parameter ErrorResp_PDiffEncM to "Error Class 3".

Description: Safety function STO activated (STO_A, STO_B)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 10
Cause: The safety function STO was activated in the operating state Operation Enabled.
Correctives: Verify correct wiring of the inputs of the safety function STO and perform a Fault Reset.

Description: STO_A and STO_B different levelParameter_SigLatchedBit 11
Cause: The levels of the inputs STO_A and STO_B were different for more than 1 second.
Correctives: Verify correct wiring of the inputs of the safety function STO.

Description: Safety function STO activated (STO_A, STO_B)Parameter_WarnLatchedBit 10
Cause: Safety function STO was activated while the power stage was disabled.
Correctives: Verify correct wiring of the inputs of the safety function STO.

Description: Frequency of the external reference value signal too highParameter_SigLatchedBit 28
Cause: The frequency of the external reference value signals (A/B signals, P/D signals or CW/CCW signals) is higher than the permissible value.
Correctives: Verify the frequency of the external reference values. Verify the gear ratio in the operating mode Electronic Gear.

Description: The selected signal input function or signal output function cannot be configured
Cause: The selected signal input function or signal output function cannot be used in the selected operating mode.
Correctives: Select another function or change the operating mode.

Description: Limit switch or reference switch signal not defined for signal input function
Cause: Reference movements require limit switches. These limit switches are not assigned to inputs.
Correctives: Assign the signal input functions Positive Limit Switch, Negative Limit Switch and Reference Switch.

Description: Configured debounce time not possible for this signal input function
Cause: The signal input function does not support the selected debounce time.
Correctives: Set the debounce time to a valid value.

Description: At least two inputs have the same signal input function.
Cause: The same signal input function has been assigned to at least two inputs.
Correctives: Reconfigure the inputs.

Description: Frequency of reference value signal is too high.Parameter_WarnLatchedBit 28
Cause: The frequency of the pulse signal (A/B, Pulse/Direction, CW/CCW) exceeds the specified range. Received pulses may be lost.
Correctives: Adapt the frequency of the reference value signal to match the input specification of the drive. Also adapt the gear ratio in the operating mode Electronic Gear to the application requirements (position accuracy and velocity).

Description: Position capture via signal input currently not possibleParameter_SigLatchedBit 28
Cause: Position capture is already being used.

Description: Interference at PTI inputParameter_WarnLatchedBit 28
Cause: Interfering pulses or impermissible edge transitions (A and B signal simultaneously) have been detected.
Correctives: Verify cable specifications, shield connection and EMC.

Description: The selected type of usage of the analog inputs is not possible.
Cause: At least two analog inputs are configured with the same type of usage.
Correctives: Reconfigure the analog inputs.

Description: System error detected: DriveCom state machine indeterminable state
System error detected: HWL low-level state machine indeterminable state
Quick Stop triggered via fieldbus
Cause: A Quick Stop has been triggered via the fieldbus. The Quick Stop option code has been set to -1 or -2 which causes the drive to transition to the operating state 9 Fault instead of the operating state 7 Quick Stop Active.

Description: Power stage cannot be enabledParameter_SigLatchedBit 4
Cause: The signal input function "Servo On" has been assigned to an input. However, there is a 0 level the signal input.
Correctives: There must be a 1 level at the signal input.

Description: Oscilloscope: No additional data available
Oscilloscope: Parameterization incomplete
Oscilloscope: Trigger variable not defined
Logging still active
Logging: No trigger defined
Logging: Invalid trigger option
Logging: No channel selected
Logging: No data available
Parameter cannot be logged
Autotuning: Moment of inertia outside permissible range
Cause: The load inertia is too high.
Correctives: Verify that the system can easily be moved.Verify the load.Use a differently rated drive.

Description: Autotuning: Test movement could not be started
Autotuning: Power stage cannot be enabled
Cause: Autotuning was not started in the operating state Ready To Switch On.
Correctives: Start Autotuning when the drive is in the operating state Ready To Switch On.

Description: Autotuning: Processing stopped
Cause: Autotuning stopped by user command or by detected error (see additional error message in error memory, for example, DC bus undervoltage, limit switches triggered)
Correctives: Remove the cause of the stop and restart Autotuning.

Description: System error detected: Parameter could not be written during Autotuning (additional info=Modbus register address)
System error detected: Parameter could not be read during Autotuning
Autotuning: Maximum permissible movement range exceededParameter_SigLatchedBit 2
Cause: The movement exceeded the adjusted movement range during Autotuning.
Correctives: Increase the movement range value or disable movement range monitoring by setting AT_DIS = 0.

Description: Autotuning: Already active
Cause: Autotuning has been started twice simultaneously or an Autotuning parameter is modified during Autotuning (parameter AT_dis and AT_dir).
Correctives: Wait for Autotuning to finish before restarting Autotuning.

Description: Autotuning: This parameter cannot be changed while Autotuning is active
Cause: Parameter AT_gain or AT_J are written during Autotuning.
Correctives: Wait for Autotuning to finish before changing the parameter.

Description: Autotuning: Friction torque or load torque too great
Cause: The current limit has been reached (parameter CTRL_I_max).
Correctives: Verify that the system can easily be moved.Verify the load.Use a differently rated drive.

Description: Autotuning: Optimization aborted
Cause: The internal Autotuning sequence has not been finished, there may have been a following error.
Correctives: See the additional information provided in the error memory.

Description: Autotuning: Velocity jump in parameter AT_n_ref is not sufficient
Cause: Parameter AT_n_ref < 2 * AT_n_tolerance.The drive only checks this for the first velocity jump.
Correctives: Modify the parameter AT_n_ref or AT_n_tolerance to meet the required condition.

Description: Autotuning: Load torque too high
Cause: Product rating is not suitable for the machine load.Detected machine inertia is too high compared to the inertia of the motor.
Correctives: Reduce load, verify rating.

Description: System error detected: Calculation error
Autotuning: Not possible to perform Autotuning
Cause: Autotuning can only be performed if no operating mode is active.
Correctives: Terminate the active operating mode or disable the power stage.

Description: Autotuning: HALT request has stopped the autotuning process
Cause: Autotuning can only be performed if no operating mode is active.
Correctives: Terminate the active operating mode or disable the power stage.

Description: System error detected: FIFO memory overflow
Motor has been changed (different type of motor)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 16
Cause: Detected motor type is different from previously detected motor.
Correctives: Confirm the change.

Description: System error detected: Hardware and firmware do not match
System error detected: Incorrect parameters for motor and power stageParameter_SigLatchedBit 30
Cause: Incorrect manufacturer parameter value (data) non-volatile memory of device.
Correctives: Replace device.

Description: Target value too high.Parameter_SigLatchedBit 30
Product of encoder simulation resolution and the maximum velocity is too highParameter_SigLatchedBit 30
Cause: Value in parameter CTRL_v_max or resolution or the encoder simulation ESIM_scale are too high.
Correctives: Reduce the resolution of the encoder simulation or the maximum velocity in parameter CTRL_v_max.

Description: Error detected during parameter switchingParameter_SigLatchedBit 30
Wake & shake cannot be started.Parameter_SigLatchedBit 30
Cause: Motor velocity is too high at the beginning of the wake and shake procedure.
Correctives: Verify that the motor is at a standstill at the beginning wake and shake procedure.

Description: Position difference during the wake and shake procedure is too high.
Cause: Incorrect motor data entered by user (especially motor resistance, motor inertia (in case of rotary motors) or motor mass (in case of linear motors)).Incorrect setting for parameter WakeAndShakeGain.
Correctives: Verify motor data.Verify setting of parameter WakeAndShakeGain.

Description: The operating state at the beginning of the commutation offset identification must be Ready To Switch On.
Correctives: Set the operating state to Ready To Switch On and restart commutation offset identification.

Description: Motor velocity too high.
Velocity value determined by velocity observer is incorrect
Cause: Incorrect system inertia for velocity observer calculations.Incorrect velocity observer dynamics.System inertia changes during operation. In this case, operation with velocity observer is not possible and the velocity observer must be deactivated.
Correctives: Change the velocity observer dynamics via the parameter CTRL_SpdObsDyn.Change the system inertia used for velocity observer calculations via the parameter CTRL_SpdObsInert.If the detected error persists, deactivate the velocity observer.

Description: Not possible to determine the commutation angle at the end of the wake and shake procedure
Cause: Incorrect motor data, for example motor resistance, motor inertia (in case of rotary motors) or motor mass (in case of linear motors).Incorrect setting for parameter WakeAndShakeGain.Holding brake (if available) not properly wired.
Correctives: Verify correct motor data.Verify setting of parameter WakesAndShakeGain.Verify correct wiring of holding brake.

Description: Velocity deviation too high
Power stage overcurrentParameter_SigLatchedBit 27
Cause: Motor short circuit and disabling of the power stage.Motor phases are inverted.
Correctives: Verify the motor power connection.

Description: Braking resistor overcurrentParameter_SigLatchedBit 27
Cause: Braking resistor short circuit.
Correctives: If you use the internal braking resistor, contact your Schneider Electric service representative.If you use an external braking resistor, verify correct wiring and rating of the braking resistor.

Description: Missing mains supply, undervoltage mains supply or overvoltage mains supplyParameter_SigLatchedBit 15
Cause: Missing phase(s) for more than 50 ms.Mains voltage is out of range.Mains frequency is out of range.
Correctives: Verify that the values of the mains power supply network comply with the technical data.

Description: DC bus overvoltageParameter_SigLatchedBit 14
Cause: Excessive regeneration during deceleration.
Correctives: Verify correct deceleration ramp, rating of drive and braking resistor.

Description: DC bus undervoltage (shutdown threshold)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 13
Cause: Power supply outage, insufficient power supply.
Correctives: Verify mains supply.

Description: DC bus undervoltage (Quick Stop threshold)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 13
Cause: Power supply outage, insufficient power supply.
Correctives: Verify mains supply.

Description: Undervoltage DC bus, missing mains supply, undervoltage mains supply or overvoltage mains supplyParameter_WarnLatchedBit 13
Cause: Missing phase(s) for more than 50 ms.Mains voltage is out of range.Mains frequency is out of range.Mains voltage and setting of parameter MON_MainsVolt do not match (for example, mains voltage is 230 V and MON_MainsVolt is set to 115 V).
Correctives: Verify that the values of the mains power supply network comply with the technical data.Verify the settings of the parameter for reduced mains voltage.

Description: The winding voltage of the motor is lower than the nominal supply voltage of the drive
Cause: If the winding voltage of the motor is lower than the nominal supply voltage of the drive, this may result in motor overtemperature due to high current ripple.
Correctives: Verify the motor temperature. In the case of overtemperature, use a motor with a higher winding voltage or use a drive with a lower nominal supply voltage.

Description: Power stage overtemperatureParameter_SigLatchedBit 18
Cause: Excessively high ambient temperature due to, for example, dust.
Correctives: Improve heat dissipation.If a fan is installed, verify correct operation of the fan.

Description: Power stage overtemperatureParameter_WarnLatchedBit 18
Cause: Excessively high ambient temperature due to, for example, dust.
Correctives: Improve heat dissipation.If a fan is installed, verify correct operation of the fan.

Description: Power stage overload (I2t)Parameter_WarnLatchedBit 30
Cause: The current has exceeded the nominal value for an extended period of time.
Correctives: Verify rating, reduce cycle time.

Description: Device overtemperatureParameter_SigLatchedBit 18
Cause: Excessively high ambient temperature due to, for example, dust.
Correctives: Improve heat dissipation.If a fan is installed, verify correct operation of the fan.

Description: Motor overtemperatureParameter_SigLatchedBit 17
Cause: Ambient temperature is too high.Duty cycle is too high.Motor not properly mounted (thermal isolation).Motor overload.
Correctives: Verify motor installation: The heat must be dissipated via the mounting surface.Reduce ambient temperature.Provide ventilation.

Description: Motor overtemperatureParameter_WarnLatchedBit 17
Cause: Ambient temperature is too high.Duty cycle is too high.Motor not properly mounted (thermal isolation).Motor overload.
Correctives: Verify motor installation: The heat must be dissipated via the mounting surface.Reduce ambient temperature.Provide ventilation.

Description: Motor overload (I2t)Parameter_WarnLatchedBit 31
Cause: The current has exceeded the nominal value for an extended period of time.
Correctives: Verify that the system can easily be moved.Verify the load.Use a differently sized motor, if necessary.

Description: No motor temperature monitoring
Cause: The temperature parameters (in electronic nameplate of motor, non-volatile memory of encoder) are unavailable or invalid; parameter A12 is equal to 0.
Correctives: Contact your Schneider Electric service representative.Replace motor.

Description: The encoder does not support motor temperature monitoring.
Braking resistor overload (I2t > 75%)Parameter_WarnLatchedBit 29
Cause: Regeneration energy too high.External loads too high.Motor velocity too high.Deceleration too fast.Insufficient braking resistor.
Correctives: Reduce load, velocity, deceleration.Verify correct braking resistor rating.

Description: Braking resistor overload (I2t > 100%)
Cause: Regeneration energy too high.External loads too high.Motor velocity too high.Deceleration too fast.Insufficient braking resistor.
Correctives: Reduce load, velocity, deceleration.Verify correct braking resistor rating.

Description: Overload of transistor for braking resistorParameter_WarnLatchedBit 28
Cause: Regeneration energy too high.External loads too high.Deceleration too fast.
Correctives: Reduce load and/or deceleration.

Description: Modbus power supply missing
Motor encoder supply voltageParameter_SigLatchedBit 16
Cause: Encoder power supply is not within permissible range of 8 V to 12 V.
Correctives: Replace the device.Contact your Schneider Electric service representative.

Description: Error detected at connection to motor encoderParameter_SigLatchedBit 16
Cause: Encoder not properly connected, EMC

Description: Error detected in motor encoder communicationParameter_SigLatchedBit 16
Cause: Encoder not properly connected, EMC

Description: Motor encoder is not supportedParameter_SigLatchedBit 16
Cause: Incompatible encoder connected.

Description: Error detected in connection motor encoderParameter_SigLatchedBit 16
Cause: Encoder not properly connected

Description: Connection to motor encoder lostParameter_SigLatchedBit 16
Cause: Encoder not properly connected

Description: Communication error detected in encoderParameter_WarnLatchedBit 16
Cause: Communication channel to encoder is subject to interference.
Correctives: Verify EMC measures.

Description: Function is not supported
Cause: The hardware revision does not support the function.

Description: The motor requires a PWM frequency (16kHz) which the power stage does not support.
Cause: The motor only works with a PWM frequency of 16 kHz (motor nameplate entry). However, the power stage does not support this PWM frequency.
Correctives: Use a motor that works with a PWM frequency of 8 kHz.Contact your Schneider Electric service representative.

Description: System error detected: Nonvolatile memory read errorParameter_SigLatchedBit 29
System error: Nonvolatile memory write errorParameter_SigLatchedBit 29
System error: Nonvolatile memory state machineParameter_SigLatchedBit 29
System error: Nonvolatile memory address errorParameter_SigLatchedBit 29
System error: Nonvolatile memory incorrect data lengthParameter_SigLatchedBit 29
System error: Nonvolatile memory not formattedParameter_SigLatchedBit 29
System error: Nonvolatile memory incompatible structureParameter_SigLatchedBit 29
System error detected: Nonvolatile memory checksum error (manufacturer data)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 29
System error detected: Nonvolatile memory checksum error (user parameters)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 29
System error detected: Nonvolatile memory checksum error (fieldbus parameters)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 29
System error detected: No valid manufacturer dataParameter_SigLatchedBit 29
System error detected: Nonvolatile memory checksum error (NoInit parameter)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 29
System error detected: Nonvolatile memory checksum error (motor parameters)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 29
System error detected: Nonvolatile memory checksum error (global control loop parameter set)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 29
System error detected: Nonvolatile memory checksum error (control loop parameter set 1)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 29
System error detected: Nonvolatile memory checksum error (control loop parameter set 2)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 29
System error detected: Nonvolatile memory checksum error (NoReset parameter)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 29
System error detected: Nonvolatile memory checksum error (hardware information)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 29
System error detected: Nonvolatile memory checksum error (for power outage data)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 29
Cause: Internal nonvolatile memory not operative.
Correctives: Restart the drive. If the detected error persists, contact your Schneider Electric service representative.

Description: System error detected: Communication with memory cardParameter_SigLatchedBit 20
System error detected: Memory card bus is busyParameter_SigLatchedBit 20
System error detected: Nonvolatile memory checksum error (administration data)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 29
System error detected: Nonvolatile memory is write-protectedParameter_SigLatchedBit 29
System error detected: Memory cardParameter_SigLatchedBit 20
Cause: The last saving procedure may not have been successful; the memory card may be inoperative.
Correctives: Retry saving the data.Replace the memory card.

Description: System error detected: Memory cardParameter_SigLatchedBit 20
Cause: The last saving procedure may not have been successful; the memory card may be inoperative.
Correctives: Retry saving the data.Replace the memory card.

Description: System error detected: Memory cardParameter_SigLatchedBit 20
Cause: The last saving procedure may not have been successful; the memory card may be inoperative.
Correctives: Retry saving the data.Replace the memory card.

Description: System error detected: No memory card availableParameter_WarnLatchedBit 20
System error detected: Data on memory card and device do not matchParameter_SigLatchedBit 20
Cause: Different type of device.Different type of power stage.Data on memory card does not match firmware version of device.

Description: System error detected: Incompatible data on the memory cardParameter_SigLatchedBit 20
System error detected: Capacity of detected memory card insufficientParameter_SigLatchedBit 20
System error detected: Memory card not formattedParameter_SigLatchedBit 20
Correctives: Update memory card (drive to card).

Description: System error detected: Memory card is write-protectedParameter_SigLatchedBit 20
Cause: The memory card has been write-protected.
Correctives: Remove memory card or disable write protection.

Description: System error detected: Incompatible memory cardParameter_SigLatchedBit 20
Cause: Memory card capacity is insufficient.
Correctives: Replace memory card

Description: Memory card implicitly written by the deviceParameter_WarnLatchedBit 20
Cause: The content of the memory card and the content of the nonvolatile memory are not identical.

Description: Nonvolatile memory file not available
Motor connection phase error detectedParameter_SigLatchedBit 26
Cause: Missing motor phase.

Description: Commutation error detected (additional info=Internal_DeltaQuep)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 26
Cause: Incorrect wiring of motor cable.Encoder signals are lost or subject to interference.The load torque is greater than the motor torque.The encoder nonvolatile memory contains incorrect data (encoder phase offset is incorrect).Motor is not adjusted.
Correctives: Verify motor phases, verify encoder wiring.Improve EMC, verify grounding and shield connection.Use a differently sized motor that can withstand the load torque.Verify the motor data.Contact your Schneider Electric service representative.

Description: System error detected: Internal software errorParameter_SigLatchedBit 30
System error detected: System stack overflowParameter_SigLatchedBit 31
System error detected: Division by zero (internal)
System error detected: Overflow during 32 bit calculation (internal)
System error detected: Size of data interface does not matchParameter_SigLatchedBit 30
Parameter outside of value range (calculation error detected)
Function not available
System error detected: Internal range exceeded
System error detected: Calculated value cannot be represented as a 32 bit value
Error detected in selection parameter
Cause: Incorrect parameter value selected.
Correctives: Verify the value to be written.

Description: System error detected: 24 VDC below undervoltage threshold for shutdown
System error detected: Internal timer basis missing (Timer0)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 30
System error detected: Memory area lockedParameter_SigLatchedBit 30
System error detected: Out of memoryParameter_SigLatchedBit 30
System error detected: Calculated value cannot be represented as a 16 bit value
System error detected: Impermissible function call from interrupt service routine
Cause: Incorrect programming

Description: Holding brake cannot be released manually.
Cause: The holding brake cannot be released manually because it is still applied manually.
Correctives: First, switch from applying the holding brake manually to Automatic, then to releasing the holding brake manually.

Description: System error detected: Invalid power stage dataParameter_SigLatchedBit 30
Cause: Error detected in power stage data stored in device (incorrect CRC), error detected in internal memory data.
Correctives: Contact your Schneider Electric service representative or replace the device.

Description: System error detected: Internal braking resistor
Cause: Internal braking resistor is inoperative or not connected.
Correctives: Contact your Schneider Electric service representative.

Description: Parameter cannot be changed because the external braking resistor is active.
Cause: An attempt is made to change one of the parameters RESext_ton, RESext_P or RESext_R even though the external braking resistor is active.
Correctives: Verify that the external braking resistor is not active if one of the parameters RESext_ton, RESext_P or RESext_R has to be changed.

Description: No external braking resistor connected
Cause: External braking resistor activated (Parameter RESint_ext), but no external resistor is detected.
Correctives: Verify wiring of the external braking resistor. Verify correct resistance.

Description: Invalid motor dataParameter_SigLatchedBit 16
Cause: Motor data is incorrect (incorrect CRC).
Correctives: Contact your Schneider Electric service representative or replace the motor.

Description: System error detected: Error in motor encoder communicationParameter_SigLatchedBit 16
Cause: EMC, detailed information can be found in the error memory that contains the error code of the encoder.
Correctives: Contact your Schneider Electric service representative.

Description: Invalid motor dataParameter_SigLatchedBit 30
Cause: Error detected in motor data stored in motor encoder, error detected in internal memory data.
Correctives: Contact your Schneider Electric service representative or replace the motor.

Description: System error detected: Motor encoder inoperativeParameter_SigLatchedBit 16
Correctives: Contact your Schneider Electric service representative or replace the motor.

Description: System error detected: Length specification for user data too greatParameter_SigLatchedBit 16
System error detected: Motor encoderParameter_WarnLatchedBit 16
System error detected: Communication with encoder not possibleParameter_WarnLatchedBit 16
Electronic motor nameplate not foundParameter_SigLatchedBit 16
Cause: Incorrect motor data (incorrect CRC).Motor without electronic motor nameplate (for example, SER motor)
Correctives: Contact your Schneider Electric service representative or replace the motor.

Description: No data segment of the electronic motor nameplate
System error detected: Motor configuration cannot be written
Not possible to write motor configuration
Incomplete motor configurationParameter_SigLatchedBit 16
Format is not supportedParameter_SigLatchedBit 16
Incorrect encoder type selected with parameter MotEnctypeParameter_SigLatchedBit 16
Error detected during the internal conversion of the motor configurationParameter_SigLatchedBit 16
Parameter of the motor configuration out of permissible rangeParameter_SigLatchedBit 16
Encoder offset: Data segment in encoder is incorrect.
Adjustment value of the encoder of the third party motor has not yet been determined.Parameter_SigLatchedBit 16
System error detected: Calibration analog/digital converter during manufacturing / incorrect BLE fileParameter_SigLatchedBit 30
System error detected: Invalid encoder parameterParameter_SigLatchedBit 16
Cause: Communication channel (Hiperface) to encoder is subject to interference, motor encoder has not been factory-parameterized.
Correctives: Contact your Schneider Electric service representative.

Description: Timeout reading the absolute position from the encoderParameter_SigLatchedBit 16
Cause: Communication channel (Hiperface) to encoder is subject to interference or motor encoder is inoperative.
Correctives: Verify EMC measures.

Description: Error bit set in Hiperface answerParameter_WarnLatchedBit 16
Cause: Insufficient EMC.
Correctives: Verify wiring (shield).

Description: Motor encoder: Position evaluation error detectedParameter_SigLatchedBit 16

Correctives: Set a speed limit for direction-dependent SLS greater than 0 RPM in the parameter _eSM_v_maxSetup or in the parameter eSM_SLSnegDirS or deactivate direction-dependent SLS via the parameter eSM_FuncSwitches.

Description: eSM module: Speed limit for SLS in negative direction has been specified, but direction-dependant SLS has not been activatedParameter_SigLatchedBit 23
Cause: Direction-dependent SLS is not active, but a speed limit for direction-dependent SLS in negative direction has been specified.
Correctives: Set the speed limit for direction-dependent SLS in negative direction in parameter eSM_SLSnegDirS to 0 RPM or activate direction-dependent SLS via the parameter eSM_FuncSwitches.

Description: eSM module: Order of speed limits for multiple SLS in positive direction is incorrectParameter_SigLatchedBit 23
Cause: The values for the speed limits for multiple SLS are not in ascending order.
Correctives: Set correct speed limits for multiple SLS.

Description: eSM module: Order of speed limits for multiple SLS in negative direction is incorrectParameter_SigLatchedBit 23
Cause: The values for the speed limits for multiple SLS are not in ascending order.
Correctives: Set correct speed limits for multiple SLS.

Description: eSM module: Invalid speed limit for multiple SLS in positive directionParameter_SigLatchedBit 23
Cause: Speed limit for multiple SLS in positive direction has a value of zero.
Correctives: Set a speed limit not equal to zero for multiple SLS.

Description: eSM module: Invalid speed limit for multiple SLS in negative direction has a value of zeroParameter_SigLatchedBit 23
Cause: Speed limit for multiple SLS in negative direction has a value of zero.
Correctives: Set a speed limit not equal to zero for multiple SLS.

Description: eSM module: Two types of multiple SLS selected at the same timeParameter_SigLatchedBit 23
Cause: eSM module: Two types of multiple SLS selected at the same time.
Correctives: Select a single type of multiple SLS.

Description: Module in fieldbus slot not correctly detectedParameter_SigLatchedBit 21
Cause: Fieldbus module not correctly mounted in the slot.Unsupported fieldbus module inserted.Fieldbus module inoperative.EMC.
Correctives: Replace fieldbus module.Improve EMC.

Description: Indeterminable type of fieldbus module detected in fieldbus slotParameter_SigLatchedBit 21
Cause: The type of module detected in fieldbus slot is not supported by the drive.
Correctives: Use supported type of fieldbus module. Refer to manual or catalog.

Description: Fieldbus module in slot 3 missingParameter_SigLatchedBit 21
Cause: Fieldbus module has been removed or fieldbus module is inoperative.
Correctives: Confirm or cancel HMI dialog box for fieldbus module replacement.Install a new fieldbus module.

Description: Parameter access error detected in fieldbus module
Cause: Fieldbus module parameter does not exist or cannot be written.

Description: Fieldbus module in slot 3 has been changedParameter_SigLatchedBit 21
Cause: The fieldbus module has been replaced by another type of fieldbus module.
Correctives: Confirm the new fieldbus module via the HMI dialog.

Description: Internal timeout in communication with fieldbus module
Cause: Internal communication with fieldbus module not correct.Fieldbus module inoperative.EMC.
Correctives: Replace fieldbus module.Improve EMC.

Description: Calculated velocity too high for operating mode Electronic GearParameter_SigLatchedBit 4
Cause: Gear ratio or reference velocity value too high
Correctives: Reduce the gear ratio or reference velocity.

Description: Position change in reference value for operating mode Electronic Gear too highParameter_SigLatchedBit 4
Cause: Position reference change is too high.Error detected at signal input for reference value.
Correctives: Reduce the resolution of the master.Verify signal input for reference value signal.

Description: Parameters cannot be writtenParameter_WarnLatchedBit 4
Cause: A data set is still active.
Correctives: Wait until the currently active data set has been terminated.

Description: Invalid value in data set (additional info = data set number (low byte) and entry (high byte))Parameter_SigLatchedBit 4
Cause: Value not possible in data set.
Correctives: See also parameters _MSM_error_num and _MSM_error_entry for additional information.

Description: Offset positioning not possibleParameter_WarnLatchedBit 4
Cause: Operating mode Electronic Gear inactive or no gear method selected.
Correctives: Start operating mode Electronic Gear and/or select a gear method.

Description: Setting the offset position is not possibleParameter_WarnLatchedBit 4
Cause: If offset positioning is active, it is not possible to set the position offset.
Correctives: Wait until ongoing offset positioning has finished.

Description: Position deviation in operating mode Electronic Gear too highParameter_SigLatchedBit 4
Cause: The position deviation has become excessively high due to a velocity limitation or the release of direction.
Correctives: Verify the velocity of the external reference values and the velocity limitation. Verify release of direction.

Description: Deceleration after HALT request still running
Cause: HALT was removed too soon.New command was sent before motor standstill was reached after a HALT request.
Correctives: Wait for complete stop before removing HALT signal.Wait until motor has come to a complete standstill.

Description: Drive in operating state Quick Stop Active
Cause: Error with error class 1 detected.Drive stopped with Quick Stop.

Description: Stop by positive limit switchParameter_SigLatchedBit 1
Cause: The positive limit switch was activated because movement range was exceeded, incorrect operation of limit switch or signal disturbance.
Correctives: Verify application.Verify limit switch function and connection.

Description: Stop by negative limit switchParameter_SigLatchedBit 1
Cause: The negative limit switch was activated because movement range was exceeded, incorrect operation of limit switch or signal disturbance.
Correctives: Verify application.Verify limit switch function and connection.

Description: Stop by reference switchParameter_SigLatchedBit 1
Power stage cannot be enabled in the operating state Not Ready To Switch On
Cause: Fieldbus: An attempt was made to enable the power stage in the operating state Not Ready To Switch On.
Correctives: Refer to the state diagram.

Description: Stop by user-initiated software stopParameter_SigLatchedBit 3
Cause: Drive is in operating state Quick Stop Active due to a software stop request. The activation of a new operating mode is not possible, the error code is sent as the response to the activation command.
Correctives: Clear break condition with command Fault Reset.

Description: Interruption by internal software stop
Cause: In the operating modes Homing and Jog, the movement is internally interrupted by an internal software stop. The activation of a new operating mode is not possible, the error code is sent as the response to the activation command.
Correctives: Perform a Fault Reset.

Description: Drive is in operating state Fault or Fault Reaction Active
Cause: Error with error class 2 or higher detected.
Correctives: Verify the error code, remove the cause and perform a Fault Reset.

Description: Drive not in operating state Operation Enabled
Cause: A command was sent that requires the drive to be in the operating state Operation Enabled (for example, a command to change the operating mode).
Correctives: Set drive to operating state Operation Enabled and repeat the command.

Description: Power stage not enabled
Cause: Command cannot be used because the power stage is not enabled (operating state Operation Enabled or Quick Stop Active).
Correctives: Set drive to an operating state in which the power stage is enabled, see state diagram.

Description: Operating mode change active
Cause: A start request for an operating mode has been received while a change of the operating mode was active.
Correctives: Wait until the operating mode change has terminated before triggering a start request for another operating mode.

Description: Profile generation interrupted
Position overflow, zero point is therefore no longer valid (ref_ok=0)
Cause: The movement range limits were exceeded and the zero point is no longer valid. An absolute movement requires a valid zero point.
Correctives: Define a valid zero point by means of the operating mode Homing.

Description: No valid zero point
Cause: Command needs a valid zero point (ref_ok=1).
Correctives: Define a valid zero point by means of the operating mode Homing.

Description: Homing active
Cause: Command cannot be used while the operating mode Homing is active.
Correctives: Wait until reference movement is finished.

Description: Overflow during calculation of acceleration
Motor is not at a standstill
Cause: Command sent which is not permissible when the motor is not at a standstill.For example:- Change of software limit switches- Change of handling of monitoring signals- Setting of reference point- Teach in of data set
Correctives: Wait until the motor has come to a standstill (x_end = 1).

Description: Operating mode active (x_end=0)
Cause: Activation of a new operating mode is not possible while another operating mode is still active.
Correctives: Wait until the command in the operating mode has finished (x_end=1)or terminate active operating mode with HALT command.

Description: Manual tuning/Autotuning: Movement out of rangeParameter_SigLatchedBit 2
Cause: The movement exceeds the parameterized maximum movement range.
Correctives: Verify permissible movement range value and time interval.

Description: Manual tuning/Autotuning: Amplitude/offset too high
Cause: Amplitude plus offset for tuning exceed internal velocity or current limitation.
Correctives: Choose lower amplitude and offset values.

Description: Halt requested
Cause: Command not permissible while Halt is requested.
Correctives: Clear Halt request and repeat command.

Description: Invalid position setting with software limit switch
Cause: Value for negative (positive) software limit switch is greater (less) than value for positive (negative) software limit switch.
Correctives: Set correct position values.

Description: Velocity range exceeded (parameter CTRL_v_max, M_n_max)
Cause: The velocity was set to a value greater than the maximum permissible velocity in parameter CTRL_v_max or M_n_max, whichever is lower.
Correctives: If the value of parameter M_n_max is greater than the value of parameter CTRL_v_max, increase the value of parameter CTRL_v_max or reduce the velocity value.

Description: Stop by positive software limit switchParameter_SigLatchedBit 2
Cause: Not possible to execute command because positive software limit switch was triggered.
Correctives: Return to the permissible movement range.

Description: Stop by negative software limit switchParameter_SigLatchedBit 2
Cause: Not possible to execute command because negative software limit switch was triggered.
Correctives: Return to the permissible movement range.

Description: Permissible position deviation exceededParameter_SigLatchedBit 8
Cause: External load or acceleration are too high.
Correctives: Reduce external load or acceleration.Use a differently rated drive, if necessary.Error response can be adjusted via parameter ErrorResp_p_dif.

Description: Invalid setting for RS422 position interface
Error detected in ramp calculation
System error detected: Processing error detected during generation of profile
Error detected during homing (additional info = detailed error code)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 4
Cause: Homing movement was stopped in response to a detected error, the detailed reason is indicated by the additional info in the error memory.
Correctives: Possible sub-error codes:E A325, E A326, E A327, E A328 or E A329.

Description: Limit switch to be approached not enabledParameter_SigLatchedBit 4
Cause: Homing to positive limit switch or negative limit switch is disabled.
Correctives: Enable limit switch via 'IOsigLimP' or 'IOsigLimN'.

Description: Reference switch not found between positive limit switch and negative limit switchParameter_SigLatchedBit 4
Cause: Reference switch inoperative or not correctly connected.
Correctives: Verify the function and wiring of the reference switch.

Description: More than one signal positive limit switch/negative limit switch/reference switch activeParameter_SigLatchedBit 4
Cause: Reference switch or limit switch not connected correctly or supply voltage for switches too low.
Correctives: Verify the wiring and 24 VDC supply voltage.

Description: Positive limit switch triggered with negative direction of movementParameter_SigLatchedBit 4
Cause: Start reference movement with negative direction (for example, reference movement to negative limit switch) and activate the positive limit switch (switch in opposite direction of movement).
Correctives: Verify correct connection and function of limit switch.Activate a jog movement with negative direction of movement (target limit switch must be connected to the negative limit switch).

Description: Negative limit switch triggered with positive direction of movementParameter_SigLatchedBit 4
Cause: Start reference movement with positive direction (for example, reference movement to positive limit switch) and activate the negative limit switch (switch in opposite direction of movement).
Correctives: Verify correct connection and function of limit switch.Activate a jog movement with positive direction of movement (target limit switch must be connected to the positive limit switch).

Description: Reference switch error detected (switch signal briefly enabled or switch overtraveled)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 4
Cause: Switch signal disturbance.Motor subjected to vibration or shock when stopped after activation of the switch signal.
Correctives: Verify supply voltage, cabling and function of switch.Verify motor response after stopping and optimize control loop settings.

Description: Positive limit switch error detected (switch signal briefly enabled or switch overtraveled)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 4
Cause: Switch signal disturbance.Motor subjected to vibration or shock when stopped after activation of the switch signal.
Correctives: Verify supply voltage, cabling and function of switch.Verify motor response after stopping and optimize control loop settings.

Description: Negative limit switch error detected (switch signal briefly enabled or switch overtraveled)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 4
Cause: Switch signal disturbance.Motor subjected to vibration or shock when stopped after activation of the switch signal.
Correctives: Verify supply voltage, cabling and function of switch.Verify motor response after stopping and optimize control loop settings.

Description: Index pulse not foundParameter_SigLatchedBit 4
Cause: Index pulse signal not connected or not working properly.
Correctives: Verify index pulse signal and connection.

Description: Reference movement to index pulse cannot be reproduced. Index pulse is too close to the switchParameter_WarnLatchedBit 4
Cause: The position difference between the index pulse and the switching point is insufficient.
Correctives: Increase the distance between the index pulse and the switching point. If possible, the distance between the index pulse and the switching point should be a half motor revolution.

Description: Jog error detected (additional info = detailed error code)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 4
Cause: Jog movement was stopped in response to a detected error.
Correctives: For additional info, verify the detailed error code in the error memory.

Description: System error detected: Invalid internal selection
Timeout Standstill Window monitoring
Cause: Position deviation after movement greater than standstill window. This may have been caused by an external load.
Correctives: Verify load.Verify settings for standstill window (parameter MON_p_win, MON_p_winTime and MON_p_winTout).Optimize control loop settings.

Description: System error detected: Jerk limitation with position offset after end of movement (additional info = offset in Inc.)
Operating mode cannot be continuedParameter_WarnLatchedBit 4
Cause: Continuation of interrupted movement in operating mode Profile Position is not possible because another operating mode had been active in the meantime.In the operating mode Motion Sequence, continuation is not possible if a motion blend was interrupted.
Correctives: Restart the operating mode.

Description: Operating mode unavailableParameter_WarnLatchedBit 4
Cause: The selected operating mode is not available.

Description: No valid zero point (ref_ok=0)Parameter_WarnLatchedBit 4
Cause: No zero point defined by means of operating mode Homing.Zero point no longer valid due to movement beyond permissible movement range.Motor does not have an absolute encoder.
Correctives: Use operating mode Homing to define a valid zero point.Use a motor with an absolute encoder.

Description: Function not available in this operating modeParameter_WarnLatchedBit 4
Cause: Activation of a function which is not available in the active operating mode.Example: Start of backlash compensation while autotuning/manual tuning is active.

Description: Motion blend is already activeParameter_WarnLatchedBit 4
Cause: Change of motion blend during the ongoing motion blend (end position of motion blend not yet reached)
Correctives: Wait for the motion blend to complete before setting the next position.

Description: No movement activatedParameter_WarnLatchedBit 4
Cause: Activation of a motion blend without movement.
Correctives: Start a movement before the motion blend is activated.

Description: Position of motion blend movement not in the range of the ongoing movementParameter_WarnLatchedBit 4
Cause: The position of the motion blend is outside of the movement range.
Correctives: Verify the position of the motion blend and the movement range.

Description: Error detected in operating mode Motion Sequence (additional info = detailed error code)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 4
Cause: The operating mode Motion Sequence was stopped in response to a detected error. Verify the error memory for details on the detected error.
Correctives: See the additional error information.

Description: Position of motion blend has already been passedParameter_WarnLatchedBit 4
Cause: The movement has passed beyond the position of the motion blend.

Description: Target velocity was not reached at motion blend position.Parameter_SigLatchedBit 4
Cause: The position of the motion blend was overtraveled, the target velocity was not reached.
Correctives: Reduce the ramp velocity so that the target velocity is reached at the position of the motion blend.

Description: Processing only possible with linear rampParameter_WarnLatchedBit 4
Cause: Motion blend position was set with a non-linear ramp.
Correctives: Set a linear ramp.

Description: Maximum position deviation between motor encoder and machine encoder exceededParameter_SigLatchedBit 8
Cause: Incorrect or inoperative encoder cable.Machine encoder not connected or not supplied correctly.Different counting directions of motor encoder and machine encoder.Incorrect setting of resolution factors (numerator or denominator) of machine encoder.
Correctives: Verify encoder connection.Verify parameterization of machine encoder.

Description: Permissible position deviation exceededParameter_WarnLatchedBit 8
Cause: External load or acceleration are too high.
Correctives: Reduce external load or acceleration.Threshold value can be adjusted via the parameter MON_p_dif_warn.

Description: No analog reference value source selectedParameter_SigLatchedBit 4
Cause: No analog reference value selected
Correctives: Select an analog reference value source.

Description: Position setting exceeds system limits
Cause: Position scaling of POSscaleDenom and POSscaleNum results in a scaling factor that is too small.
Correctives: Change POSscaleDenom and POSscaleNum in such a way as to increase the resulting scaling factor.

Description: Velocity setting exceeds system limits
Cause: The velocity scaling of 'VELscaleDenom' and 'VELscaleNum' results in a scaling factor that is too small.The velocity has been set to a value greater than the maximum possible velocity (the maximum velocity is 13200 RPM).
Correctives: Change 'VELscaleDenom' and 'VELscaleNum' in such a way as to increase the resulting scaling factor.

Description: Ramp setting exceeds system limits
Cause: The ramp scaling of 'RAMPscaleDenom' and 'RAMPscaleNum' results in a scaling factor that is too small.
Correctives: Change of 'RAMPscaleDenom' and 'RAMPscaleNum' in such a way as to increase the resulting scaling factor.

Description: Resolution of scaling too high (range exceeded)
Change for jerk filter input position too greatParameter_SigLatchedBit 4
Cause: Operating mode Electronic Gear with processing method 'Position synchronization with compensation movement' has been activated which resulted in a position change greater than 0.25 revolutions.
Correctives: Deactivate jerk filter processing for Electronic Gear or use processing method 'Position synchronization without compensation movement'.

Description: Function cannot be executed with this position scaling factorParameter_SigLatchedBit 4
Cause: The positions scaling factor is set to a value less than 1rev/131072usr_p, which is less than the internal resolution.In the operating mode Cyclic Synchronous Position, the resolution is not set to 1rev/131072usr_p.
Correctives: Use a different position scaling factor or deactivate the selected function.

Description: Error detected during relative movement after capture (additional info = detailed error code)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 4
Cause: Movement was stopped by error.
Correctives: Verify the error memory.

Description: Function Relative Movement After Capture not assigned to a digital input
Correctives: Assign the function Relative Movement After Capture to a digital input.

Description: Deceleration still running
Cause: Command is not permissible during deceleration.
Correctives: Wait until motor has come to a complete standstill.

Description: Target position overtraveled with function Relative Movement After CaptureParameter_SigLatchedBit 4
Cause: Stopping distance too small or velocity too high at the point in time of the capture event.
Correctives: Reduce the velocity.

Description: Request cannot be processed since the relative movement after capture is still active
Selected data set cannot be startedParameter_SigLatchedBit 4
Cause: The data set with the selected number is not available.
Correctives: Verify the number of the data set.

Description: Movement to new reference position is not possible after a limit switch has been triggered and a Fault Reset has been performed
Cause: The difference between the actual position and the reference position is too great.

Description: Permissible velocity deviation exceededParameter_SigLatchedBit 8
Cause: Load or acceleration too high.
Correctives: Reduce load or acceleration.

Description: RS485/Modbus: Indeterminable serviceParameter_WarnLatchedBit 5
Cause: Unsupported Modbus service was received.
Correctives: Verify application on the Modbus master.

Description: Incorrect I/O data configuration (additional info = Modbus register address)Parameter_SigLatchedBit 21
Cause: The I/O data configuration or the Modbus I/O scanning configuration contains an invalid parameter.
Correctives: Verify the configuration of the I/O data.

Description: Fieldbus module: General error detectedParameter_WarnLatchedBit 21
Fieldbus module: Controlling communication channel has been closedParameter_SigLatchedBit 21
Fieldbus module: Internal communication error detectedParameter_SigLatchedBit 21
Fieldbus module: I/O data timeoutParameter_SigLatchedBit 21
Fieldbus module: I/O data mapping error detectedParameter_SigLatchedBit 21
Fieldbus module: Nonvolatile memory error detected in moduleParameter_SigLatchedBit 21
Fieldbus module: Active IOC physical layer does not match the IOC physical layer of the detected fieldbus module.Parameter_SigLatchedBit 21
Cause: The manufacturer data has been stored with a physical layer different from the physical layer normally used by the module.
Correctives: Contact your Schneider Electric service representative.

Description: Fieldbus module: Synchronization heartbeat lost between module and driveParameter_SigLatchedBit 21
Cyclic communication: Incorrect cycle timeParameter_SigLatchedBit 21
Cause: The drive does not support the configured cycle time or the difference between the measured cycle time and the configured cycle time is too great.
Correctives: Change the cycle time in the master controller to a cycle time supported by the drive or verify synchronization requirements.

Description: Cyclic communication: Synchronization signal missingParameter_SigLatchedBit 21
Cause: Two cycles have passed without a synchronization signal having been received.
Correctives: Analyze the communication.

Description: Cyclic communication: Incorrect synchronizationParameter_SigLatchedBit 21
Cause: One signal was missing and the expected second signal was received at an incorrect point in time. The master controller may be unable to provide the required synchronization signals at the set cycle time, for example, due to insufficient computing power.
Correctives: Analyze the communication or increase the cycle time.

Description: Cyclic communication: The selected cycle time tolerance is too highParameter_SigLatchedBit 21
Cause: The cycle time tolerance may not exceed one quarter of the set cycle time.
Correctives: Enter a correct value.

Description: Cyclic Communication: Drive is not synchronous with master cycleParameter_WarnLatchedBit 21
Cause: Operating mode has been activated but drive is not synchronized to external synchronization signal.
Correctives: After having started the synchronization mechanism, wait for 120 cycles before activating the operating mode.

Description: RS485/Modbus: Protocol error detectedParameter_WarnLatchedBit 5
Cause: Logical protocol error detected: Incorrect length or unsupported subfunction.
Correctives: Verify application on the Modbus master.

Description: RS485/Modbus: Interruption of the connectionParameter_SigLatchedBit 5
Cause: Connection monitoring has detected an interruption of the connection.
Correctives: Verify all connections and cables used for data exchange. Verify that the device is on.

Description: RS485/Modbus: Interruption of the connectionParameter_WarnLatchedBit 5
Cause: Connection monitoring has detected an interruption of the connection.
Correctives: Verify all connections and cables used for data exchange. Verify that the device is on.

Description: RS485/Modbus: Incorrect number of monitor objectsParameter_WarnLatchedBit 5
Drive Profile Lexium: On activation of the profile, no dmControl, refA or refB has been mapped.
Cause: dmControl, refA or refB have not been mapped.
Correctives: Map dmControl, refA or refB.

Description: Insufficient velocity resolution due to velocity scaling
Cause: Due to the configured velocity scaling, the velocity resolution in REFA16 is insufficient.
Correctives: Change the velocity scaling.

Description: Drive Profile Lexium: Write request with incorrect data type.
